title: Public transport for the NRL Round 17 –  Melbourne Storm v Cronulla Sharks:  Sunday 29 June 2025
articleContent:
Public transport for the NRL Round 17 –  Melbourne Storm v Cronulla Sharks:  Sunday 29 June 2025Extra services will help you get home from AAMI Park.

Kick-off is at 2:00 pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Disruptions:

  • For passengers on the Frankston line, buses replace trains between Cheltenham and Frankston.
  • For passengers on the Stony Point line, buses replace trains between Frankston and Stony Point.
  • For passengers on the Sunbury line, buses replace trains between North Melbourne and Sunbury, and between Watergardens and Sunbury.

 Metropolitan train

Return service from Richmond Station

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 4:06 pm from Platform 10
  • Sandringham – leaving at 4:14 pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

 Regional train

  • Normal services departing from Southern Cross Station
